intro: Leucolophus, commonly known as the white-lipped plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to regions of southern and eastern Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Leucolophus species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and pharmacological research.
